cis.monopoly.gameDrawers

Class PieceDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis.monopoly.gameDrawers.PieceDrawer

  • public final class PieceDrawer
extends java.lang.Object

    PieceDrawer

    This class is used to draw the pieces on the board as well as draw their movement.
    Version:
    0.7
    Author:
    Kyle Turske

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PIECE_SIZE_BIG
      Used to define the size of the piece if the board is big.
      static int PIECE_SIZE_SMALL
      Used to define the size of the piece if the board is small.

    • Method Detail

      • drawPiece

        public static void drawPiece(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                             double xpos,
                             double ypos,
                             int pieceID)
        Draws the piece on the canvas as an image.
        Parameters:
        gc - This is the graphics context that belongs to the canvas that you want to draw the piece on on
        xpos - The horizontal position
        ypos - The vertical position
        pieceID - The id of the piece used to draw on the board. All of the different piece png's are have a filename called "piece#.png" where the pound symbol represents the number. If the ID entered is 0, then a white square will be drawn in that location.

      • movePiece

        public static void movePiece(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                             int playerID,
                             int position,
                             int pieceID)
        Draws the player piece based upon what pieceID they have selected (color, and eventually icon) and what their ID is.
        Parameters:
        playerID - The id of the player that is moving.
        position - The position of the player on the board (0-39).
        gc - This is the graphics context that belongs to the canvas that you want to draw the piece on on
        pieceID - The id of the piece used to draw on the board. All of the different piece png's are have a filename called "piece#.png" where the pound symbol represents the number. If the ID entered is 0, then a white square will be drawn in that location.

      • drawFullPlayerMove

        public static void drawFullPlayerMove(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                                      int playerID,
                                      int position,
                                      int roll,
                                      int pieceID)
        Draws the move of the player on the board. If the old position of the player plus the roll is over the length of the board array, then the new player position will go back to the beginning and continue. Otherwise, the new player position will be the old position plus the roll. Also draws a white square where the old player position is.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context connected to the board canvas.
        playerID - The id of the current player making a turn.
        position - Where the player currently is.
        roll - The number of spaces to move.
        pieceID - Determines the color (eventually icon) belonging to the current player.

      • drawPlayerGoToJail

        public static void drawPlayerGoToJail(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                                      int playerID,
                                      int position,
                                      int pieceID)
        When the player lands in jail, the BoardDrawer needs to reflect this. So when the player lands on the go to Jail space, the player will be moved to the Jail space.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context connected to the board canvas.
        playerID - The id of the current player making a turn.
        position - Where the player currently is.
        pieceID - Determines the icon belonging to the current player.

      • drawPlayerSpaceMove

        public static void drawPlayerSpaceMove(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                                       int playerID,
                                       int oldPos,
                                       int newPos,
                                       int pieceID)
        Draws the player if they move after the spaceCheck.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context connected to the board canvas.
        playerID - The id of the current player making a turn.
        oldPos - The space the player was before the space check.
        newPos - The space the player landed on after the space check.
        pieceID - Determines the icon belonging to the current player.
